definition: to wander about destitute/to be stranded
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
to wander far from home

sentences.english: But I AM cast on an island, where I see no wild beasts to hurt me, as I saw on the coast of Africa.
sentences.chinese: 在我所流落的孤岛上，没有我在非洲看到的那些猛兽。

sentences.english: All the people who flying over other cities will go home to celebrate with their families.
sentences.chinese: 所有流落异乡的人都会回家过节。

sentences.english: He gravitated to the Outer Rim, where he eventually began racing with outlaw swoop gangs.
sentences.chinese: 他流落到外环，开始和为非作歹的飞车党鬼混。

sentences.english: Nobody knows who it is,so they call it,they find it wandering on the streets.
sentences.chinese: 没人知道他是谁，他流落街头。

sentences.english: The auctioneer said it was a mystery how the 16-inch high piece ended up in London.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖行称，尚不清楚这件花瓶是如何流落到伦敦的。

sentences.english: Outside the trade is being sent in experimental process unexpectedly, red driftage reached another world south.
sentences.chinese: 不料实验过程中发生意外，南红流落到了另一个世界。

sentences.english: Not if it means putting local workers on the streets.
sentences.chinese: 如果因此会使本地工人流落街头的话就不行。

sentences.english: How the hilt of a sword wandered so far from the smithy.
sentences.chinese: 这剑柄怎会流落到铁匠铺外如此遥远的地方。

sentences.english: The fate of girls on the streets is even grimmer than that of boys.
sentences.chinese: 那些流落街头的女孩子的命运比男孩子们要悲惨得多。

sentences.english: How does a King's Landing lad end up with a free company?
sentences.chinese: 一个君临的小伙子怎么流落到自由兵团里来了？

sentences.english: And you are not a pining outcast amongst strangers?
sentences.chinese: 你没有憔悴不堪，流落在异乡人中间吗？

sentences.english: I always wondered — how do they get there?
sentences.chinese: 我一直在想，他们是怎么会流落街头的？

sentences.english: They roved in foreign lands for more than twenty years and returned to their hometown at long last.
sentences.chinese: 他们流落异乡二十余载，最后终于返回故里。

sentences.english: And the jade hairpin was drifted into the bald Panjiayuan?
sentences.chinese: 玉簪流落到光秃的潘家园？

sentences.english: He'll again?Full amber light, living in Hong Lu cherry lips.
sentences.chinese: 玉杯酙满琥珀光，香露流落樱桃唇。

sentences.english: Thou wilt find, Eternal Traveller, marks of thy footsteps across my songs.
sentences.chinese: 永恒的流落者，你可以在我的歌中发现你的萍踪。

definition: to wander far from home
to force into exile/to be exiled/in exile
to die in a foreign land/to die abroad
variant of 漂泊[piao1 bo2]
to run away from trouble/to flee from calamity/to be a refugee
to flee/flight (from danger)/fugitive
no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
to conceal one's identity/living incognito
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to meet with misfortune/to fall into dire straits
homeless and miserable/forced to leave home and wander from place to place/to live as a refugee
to offer shelter/to have sb in one's care
to live away from home
chaos of war
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
